|brand = Buffalo |model = WLA2-G54C |submodelappend = <!-- yes, for space --> |submodel = <!-- SubModel number, Leave blank for unknown --> |revision = <!-- Model Revision, Leave blank for none or unknown --> |subrevision = <!-- Model Subrevision, Leave blank for none or unknown --> |model_part_num = |page_start_date = 11/22/2010 |page_start_origon = https://infodepot.fandom.com/wiki/Buffalo_WLA2-G54C |wlclass = G54 |series = <!-- Device series --> |type = access point,bridge,repeater |sernum = <!-- First 4 or so for easy version identification --> |fcc_id = FDI-09101669-0 |icid = <!-- Industry Canada Identification number, Leave blank for unknown --> |us_id = <!-- US ID --> |boardid = <!-- Board Identification, Leave blank for none --> |ecc_id = <!-- eec-id -->
|cpu1chip1 = Broadcom;BCM4712; |cpu1_cores = 1 |cpu1_type = MIPS |cpu1_type_rev = BMIPS3300 |cpu1spd = 200 <!-- 200 MHz --> |is_doc = |bus = <!-- 8-bit, 16-bit, 32-bit, 64-bit, Leave blank for none -->
|flash1type = <!-- Parallel,Serial(SPI),NAND,Compact Flash --> |fla1_num = <!-- 1,2,3,4 --> |fla1chip = Intel;TE28F320J3C110; |flash1size = 4 |flash1maxsize = <!-- Maximum size firmware can be in bytes -->
|ram1type = <!-- DDR,DDR2,DDR3,DDR4 --> |ram1type1 = <!-- SO-DIMM,SDRAM --> |ram1spd = <!-- RAM speed --> |ram1size = 16 |ram1chip = Dynachips;D98SD6416AH-6; |ram1_num = <!-- Number of Ram chips --> |nvramsize = <!-- 32, 60, 64, etc... in kb, Leave blank for unknown -->
|eth_cpu = true |eth2chip = IC+;IP101; |lan_ports = 1 |lan_speed = 100MbE |ethstandard = <!-- auto --> |portbasedvlan = <!-- Support for port based vlan tagging, Leave blank for unknown --> |802.1qvlan = <!-- Support for 802.1q vlan tagging, Leave blank for unknown --> |auto_mdix = <!-- mdix support --> |sup_jumbo = <!-- Jumbo frames support --> |ethoui = <!-- Leave blank for unknown -->
|bootwait = <!-- On or Off, Leave blank for unknown --> |stockbootloader = <!-- Name;Version;Distro --> |stockos = <!-- Name;Version;Distro -->
|pwr_volt_type = VDC |pwr_vdc = 3.3 |pwr_amp_dc = 2 |pwr_conn = barrel |pwr_barrel_outer = <!-- Outer barrel size in mm --> |pwr_barrel_inner = <!-- Inner barrel size in mm --> |pwr_barrel_len = <!-- Length of barrel --> |pwr_pol = <!-- Connector polarity -->
|serial = <!-- Full Serial info --> |jtag = <!-- Full JTAG info -->
|specialfeat = <!-- Features that don't fit any place else, Leave blank for none --> |flags = <!-- flags, Leave blank for none --> |addchip = <!-- Additional Chips --> |802dot11_protocols = bg
|defaulip = 192.168.11.100 |defaultlogin = root |defaultpass = <!-- default Password, Leave blank for unknown --> |defaultssid = <!-- default Wireless ID, Leave blank for unknown --> |defaultssid_regex = |default_ch = <!-- Defaults channel(s) Radio(s) are set to --> |manuf = Gemtek |manuf_model = WAPB-124G |manuf_rev = <!-- Manufacturer Revision --> |is_manuf = No |tpfirmware = DD-WRT, OpenWrt
|availability = <!-- Market availability --> |eoldate = <!-- End of Life date --> |fccapprovdate = 12/28/2004 |estreldate = <!-- Estimated release date --> |estprice = <!-- Estimated retail price in US dollars --> |upc = 747464109411 |ean = <!-- EAN number --> |dx_sku = <!-- DealExtreme sku --> |newegg = <!-- newegg item number --> |asin = B0006NMS74 |asin_country = <!-- ASIN country --> |asin2 = <!-- ASIN number --> |asin_country2 = <!-- ASIN country --> |countrymanuf = <!-- Country device was manufactured in -->
|buttons = <!-- buttons available --> |led = <!-- Led colors and descriptions --> |dimensions = <!-- Size of device {{convert |length|x|widthordepth|x|height|in|mm}} --> |weight = <!-- Weight of device {{convert|weight|oz|g}} -->
|wi1_if_name = |rad1chip1cpu = true |rad1chip2 = Broadcom;BCM2050; |rad1oui = <!-- Only if different from above OUI --> |rad1_ant_conn = MC |rad1stand = IEEE 802.11b/g |rad1g = 54 |rad1b = 11 |rad1freq = 2.4 |rad1correv = 7 |rad1cap = <!-- radio capabilities, Leave blank for none or unknown -->
}}{{TIDTOC|embedded}} ==Overview== OEM [[Gemtek]] WAPB-124G (WAPB-124G V01)
==Links of Interest== *[http://www.buffalotech.com/files/downloads/WLA2-G54C-QSG.pdf Quick start guide] **[http://www.dd-wrt.com/phpBB2/viewtopic.php?t=33277 WLA2-G54C : JTAG Questions...] On the '''DD-WRT''' Forum
==Flashing== {{Flashnotice}} ===Flashing dd-wrt=== Supported by dd-wrt as of = v23 SP3 :initial flash: use [[TechInfoDepot:DD-WRT/ddadder|ddadder]] or [[TechInfoDepot:DD-WRT/TFTP flash|Tftp flash]]
Please insert instructions here
===Flashing OpenWrt=== {{OpenWrtNotice|notrecommended}} {{OpenWrtNotice|insufficient}} {{OpenWrtNotice|endsupport|2022|19.07.10}} {{OpenWrtNotice|broadcomwifi}} {{OpenWrt |techdata = |wikipage = |forumpage = https://forum.archive.openwrt.org/viewtopic.php?id=4835 |forumpage2 = |forumpage3 = |github = |target = |subtarget = |arch = |support_started_version = ? |current_supported_version = ? |unsupportedfuncntions = |comment = }} [https://cyberforat.squat.net/openwrt/OpenWrt-HOWTO/x67.html OpenWrt HOWTO]
Please insert instructions here
==JTAG-Serial Info== ===JTAG=== ====JTAG Pinouts==== =====JTAG Pinouts=====
nTRST 1o o2 GND TDI 3o o4 GND TDO 5o o6 GND TMS 7o o8 GND TCK 9o o10 GND nSRST 11o o12 N/C
'''Using [[Universal_JTAG_User_Manual_(Parallel)|Universal JTAG Adapter]]'''
white 1o o2 black red 3o o4 GND blue 5o o6 GND green 7o o8 GND yelow 9o o10 GND orange 11o o12 N/C
* /noemw switch required
====JTAG Recovery==== #Backup CFE x2 (Compare the files, they must match exactly or there is something wrong with your JTAG setup) #Erase Wholeflash x2 #Flash CFE #Unplug Power #Unplug JTAG Cable
[[TechInfoDepot:DD-WRT/TFTP flash#Linksys_TFTP_GUI|TFTP]]:
#Set Rig ip static 192.168.1.10 #Plug network cable from rig to port 1 #Plug in power #click upgrade. #wait, wait, wait. If you cannot browse the GUI of the router, return to step 1. #Hard Reset 30\30\30
[[Category:English Documentation]]
